segments.text: Lili , let ’ s take a vacation !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: George , how can we ? Vacations cost money . And this month we don ’ t have much money left after paying the rent .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , Lili , we can visit different places in the state in our van 10 . We are not going to take a plane or stay at a hotel this time . Trust me , it won ’ t cost much .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Let ’ s see . Gas , food , recreation , we won ’ t spend much . Come on . Don ’ t hesitate . We need to get out of the house once in a while . We have been working hard , haven ’ t we ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Maybe you ’ re right . When do you plan to go ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The sooner the better ! I can ’ t wait !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , I don ’ t know where we ’ re going yet .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: As long as we ’ re going , you can decide where to go . I trust your judgments . I know you miss Chinese food , so we can eat at a Chinese restaurant this time .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Let ’ s go to Chicago.We can have lunch in Chinatown.Then we can go to a ball game at Wrigley Field !
segments.speaker: S2
